file_content.text: That's it, then. Better hope your boss knows how to make a convincing forgery.
Of course, there's going to be a bloodbath once Nem'ro and Toth'lazhen see what's on the disc.
How do you know what's on the holodisc?
You have some information?
All I know is what your "Keeper" told us. But I'm not stupid.
What?
Quiet.
I just thought you might appreciate the warning.
If that disc really names all of Fa'athra's business partners, it probably identifies half the people in Jiguuna. Merchants, gangsters, debtors--the usual scum.
When Nem'ro gets ahold of it, he'll want revenge on anyone who dared to go to Fa'athra behind his back. There'll be bodies clogging the gutters for weeks.
What are you up to, Kaliyo? I wouldn't think you'd care what Nem'ro does.
And you're concerned?
I don't. But I thought you might.
It's brutal--but if it helps Nem'ro, it could help our position.
Won't that strengthen us?
It would make Nem'ro happy, but I doubt it'd actually help his business. Different things.
Any particular reason I should be bothered?
So what?
Only if you plan to stick around and watch the excitement.
If you're feeling queasy, you could always erase the extra data and scratch up the disc. Make it look like only the doctored recording "miraculously" survived the damage.
So, we deliver Keeper's forgery without the real data. Nem'ro doesn't get his revenge spree. The risk is that Toth'lazhen figures out you erased the good stuff.
I'm not endangering the mission to protect the lowlifes of Hutta.
No taking chances.
Aw--aren't we dedicated? I knew I'd learn something about you on this mission.
There's no need to let Nem'ro carry out a massacre. We'll be as careful as we can.
Let's erase it.
Your call, agent. I knew I'd learn something about you--just don't expect me to defend you if someone realizes the truth.
So erasing the data is risky. I thought you enjoyed a little risk.
We'll chance it. It'll be fun.
Who says I don't? I'll do the damage--we'll see how far we can take this con.
Now, let's get that thing to Toth'lazhen and see what happens....
